Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

ListItem.title: Thymoma with more than one histological pattern

ListItem.title: Thymic carcinoma with adenoid cystic carcinoma-like features

Question.title: Site(s) Involved by Direct Tumor Invasion

ListItem.title: Encapsulated tumor or capsule missing but without invasion into surrounding tissue

ListItem.name: LI_367300
ListItem.title: Microscopic transcapsular invasion into thymic or perithymic fat

ListItem.name: LI_367301
ListItem.title: Macroscopic invasion into thymic or perithymic fat

Question.title: Distance from Tumor to Closest Margin

ListItem.name: LI_11704
ListItem.title: Not applicable (no regional lymph nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.title: All regional lymph nodes negative for tumor

ListItem.name: LI_358142

Question.name: Q_56666
Question.title: Number of Lymph Nodes with Tumor

Section.name: S_17795
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note C)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_58655
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_58655_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_44683
DisplayedItem.title: Involvement must be microscopically confirmed in pathological staging, if possible.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_57667
DisplayedItem.title: T categories are defined by “levels” of invasion; they reflect the highest degree of invasion regardless of how many other (lower-level) structures are invaded. T1, level 1 structures: thymus, anterior mediastinal fat, mediastinal pleura; T2, level 2 structures: pericardium; T3, level 3 structures: lung, brachiocephalic vein, superior vena cava, phrenic nerve, chest wall, hilar pulmonary vessels; T4, level 4 structures: aorta (ascending, arch, or descending), arch vessels, intrapericardial pulmonary artery, myocardium, trachea, esophagus.

ListItem.name: LI_327733
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_49655
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

DisplayedItem.name: DI_47470
DisplayedItem.title: pT1: Tumor encapsulated or extending into the mediastinal fat; may involve the mediastinal pleura

ListItem.name: LI_41981
ListItem.title: pT1a: Tumor with no mediastinal pleura involvement

ListItem.name: LI_54925
ListItem.title: pT1b: Tumor with direct invasion of mediastinal pleura

ListItem.name: LI_51699
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor with direct invasion of the pericardium (either partial or full thickness)

ListItem.name: LI_41812
ListItem.title: pT3: Tumor with direct invasion into any of the following: lung, brachiocephalic vein, superior vena cava, phrenic nerve, chest wall, or extrapericardial pulmonary artery or veins

ListItem.name: LI_58546
ListItem.title: pT4: Tumor with invasion into any of the following: aorta (ascending, arch, or descending), arch vessels, intrapericardial pulmonary artery, myocardium, trachea, esophagus

ListItem.name: LI_327735
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (no nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_327736
ListItem.title: pN not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_55111
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis

ListItem.name: LI_59439
ListItem.title: pN1: Metastasis in anterior (perithymic) lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_59047
ListItem.title: pN2: Metastasis in deep intrathoracic or cervical lymph nodes

ListItem.name: LI_51530
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_51530_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_39595
DisplayedItem.title: pM1: Pleural, pericardial, or distant metastasis

ListItem.name: LI_40873
ListItem.title: pM1a: Separate pleural or pericardial nodule(s)

ListItem.name: LI_53465
ListItem.title: pM1b: Pulmonary intraparenchymal nodule or distant organ metastasis

Question.name: Q_378531
Question.title: Modified Masaoka Stage (applies only to thymomas in addition to TNM categories)

ListItem.name: LI_8306
ListItem.title: Stage I: Grossly and microscopically encapsulated (includes microscopic invasion into, but not through, the capsule)

ListItem.name: LI_378532
ListItem.title: Stage IIb: Macroscopic capsular invasion into thymic or perithymic fat, or grossly adherent to, but not breaking through, mediastinal pleura or pericardium

ListItem.name: LI_8309
ListItem.title: Stage III: Macroscopic invasion of neighboring organs

ListItem.name: LI_8345
ListItem.title: Stage IVa: Pleural or pericardial dissemination

ListItem.name: LI_8354
ListItem.title: Stage IVb: Hematogenous or lymphatic dissemination
